definition: (obsolete) in a mellow manner, slightly and pleasantly intoxicated from alcohol or a drug (especially marijuana), make or grow (more) mellow
details:
adverb
- (obsolete) in a mellow manner
= synonyms: mellowly
adjective
- slightly and pleasantly intoxicated from alcohol or a drug (especially marijuana)
= synonyms: high
- having attained to kindliness or gentleness through age and experience
= example: having attained to kindliness or gentleness through age and experience
= synonyms: mellow, mellowed
- having attained to kindliness or gentleness through age and experience
= example: having attained to kindliness or gentleness through age and experience
= synonyms: mellow
- having a full and pleasing flavor through proper aging
= example: having a full and pleasing flavor through proper aging
= synonyms: mellowed
- unhurried and relaxed
= example: unhurried and relaxed
= synonyms: laid-back
verb
- make or grow (more) mellow
= example: make or grow (more) mellow
- become more relaxed, easygoing, or genial
= example: become more relaxed, easygoing, or genial
= synonyms: melt, mellow out
- soften, make mellow
= example: soften, make mellow
